section.p: The dispensing or issuing of medication for an inpatient.

ol.li: Extends Medication Dispense

Contains exactly one [1..1] ward, where its type is Ward
The ward where the dispense took place.
Extends Medication Dispense

Contains zero or more [0..*] comments with data type String
Contains comments as deemed necessary by the pharmacy staff for originalDispense or partialDispense or refillDispense (Free text).Note changes made June 2 2009 per CDS\Hdr order set issue. VHIM disagrees with approach needs be re-reviewed in the future. Changes are set attribute comments multipilicity to '*'.

Contains zero or one [0..1] dateTimeDispensed with data type Point In Time
The date and time that the medication was dispensed. Dispense = "to make up and distribute (medicine), esp. on prescription." (Random House Unabridged Dictionary)

Contains zero or one [0..1] dateTimeFilled with data type Point In Time
The date and time that the medication was dispensed. Dispense = "to make up and distribute (medicine), esp. on prescription." (Random House Unabridged Dictionary)

Contains zero or one [0..1] daysSupply with data type Integer
The length of time in days that the quantity dispensed will last if consumed at the rate prescribed. For example if the patient is instructed to take 2 pills a day, 60 pills will last 30 days.

Contains exactly one [1..1] fillSequenceNumber with data type Integer
"The code indicating whether the prescription is an original or a refill." Valid values are 0=original; 1-99=refills. - NCPDP Data Element 403-D3 |Telecom^Claim^4 3-D3^Fill Number| |Script^SRC^030^7897^Fill Number|

Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id
The unique identifier for this dispense, also known as a "Fill Id". Question: Do all fills get a fill id, or only refills and partial fills?

Contains zero or one [0..1] quantityDispensed with data type Physical Quantity
The quanitity of the medication dispensed to this patient in fulfillment of a request.
Contains exactly one [1..1] specialPackaging with data type Code
Contains zero or one [0..1] attender, where its type is Attender

Contains exactly one [1..1] pharmacist, where its type is Individual Provider
The pharmacist responsible for dispensing the medication for this outpatient order.

Contains exactly one [1..1] pharmacy, where its type is Pharmacy
The Outpatient Pharmacy Division which filled the prescription.
Contains zero or one [0..1] pharmacyManufacturedProduct, where its type is Pharmacy Manufactured Product
Contains zero or one [0..1] productInstance, where its type is Medicinal Product Instance
Contains zero or one [0..1] dispenseRecipient, where its type is Dispense Recipient
Contains zero or one [0..1] filler, where its type is Individual Provider
Contains zero or one [0..1] dispenser, where its type is Individual Provider
Contains zero or more [0..*] device, where its type is Device

Contains exactly one [1..1] ward, where its type is Ward
The ward where the dispense took place.
